candidates.title: `om init`: Faster registry loading using JSON cache
candidates.body:
Precache the registry flake output in JSON file, so we don't have to evaluate all of the Nix (which can grow exponentially as we add more inputs, with their own nested inputs).

Will refactor the flakreate module organization in later PR.

candidates.title: Port nixci integration test to omnix-cli tests
Add `om ci`
candidates.body:
Let's include nixci (as `om ci`) in our #140 

This PR includes #181

candidates.title: Import nixci
candidates.body: Let's get `om ci` working as part of MVP and nixpkgs release.

candidates.title: cli: add shell completion
candidates.body: Resolves #56

candidates.title: `om init`: Flesh out CLI test
candidates.body:
Basic tests for now.

With `inquire` we have no choice but to use the `rexpect` crate; see https://github.com/mikaelmello/inquire/issues/71#issuecomment-1977138491

candidates.title: Link `om init` to `flakreate`
candidates.body:
`om init` will now run flakreate.

Make flakreate a library.

Add CLI test stub (not used)

candidates.title: Import `flakreate` repo
candidates.body:
Import https://github.com/juspay/flakreate into `./crates/flakreate`, and upgrade to use the newer `nix_rs`.

https://github.com/juspay/flakreate/issues/4

candidates.title: Use flake-schemas
candidates.body:
This PR enforces `nix flake show` to use `nix` compiled from https://github.com/DeterminateSystems/nix-src/tree/flake-schemas by default (see https://github.com/NixOS/nix/pull/8892). This allows defining a custom schema of the user's choice, with the default set to https://github.com/DeterminateSystems/flake-schemas. 

TODO:
- [x] ~~Wrap `om` with `nix-flake-schemas` script~~ Allow overriding the `nix` with flake-schemas via `NIX_FLAKE_SCHEMAS_BIN` env
- [x] Use flake-schemas in `omnix-gui`
- [x] parse type of flake output from flake-schemas
- [x] `nix_rs` ChangeLog

resolves #161

candidates.title: Add CLI integration tests
candidates.body:
Instead of testing the CLI in bash, test them the Rust way.

cf. 

- [Test Organization > Integration Tests](https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/ch11-03-test-organization.html#integration-tests)
- [Testing CLI applications by running them](https://rust-cli.github.io/book/tutorial/testing.html#testing-cli-applications-by-running-them)

Note that these tests are not run during Nix build due to sandboxing issues (`NixEnv` detection fails), so we run them separately in CI.

candidates.title: omnix-cli: `om show` init
candidates.body: resolves #147

candidates.title: Initialize logging
candidates.body:
- Setup bare logging (like `nix_health` does)
- Use `clap_verbosity_flag` crate https://github.com/clap-rs/clap-verbosity-flag for `-v` and `-q`
- Fix a double `NixEnv` evaluation on `nix_health`
- cli: Setup `human-panic`

candidates.title: health: Initialize `om health`
candidates.body: Runs nix-health, but doesn't configure logging yet.

candidates.title: `nix_rs`/`nix_health`: Import from separate repo
candidates.body:
- Import `nix_rs` from https://github.com/juspay/nix-rs
- Import `nix_health` from https://github.com/juspay/nix-health

Let's keep them in this mono repo for ease of development alongside omnix.

We will potentially eventually move `nixci` into this repo as well (before #151).

candidates.title: `omnix-cli`: Initialize CLI argument handling
candidates.body: Introduces `clap` crate, and stubs out `init` and `show` commands for #140

candidates.title: Create `omnix` library crate
candidates.body: The `omnix` crate will be shared between the CLI and GUI crates.

candidates.title: Initialize `omnix-cli` crate
candidates.body:
Add `./crates/omnix-cli` (hello world) for building the CLI on top of. Build using `nix build .#omnix-cli`

For Nix support, this involved doing https://github.com/juspay/rust-flake/pull/11

candidates.title: Use cargo workspaces
candidates.body: This paves the way for having multiple frontends, like a CLI tool.

candidates.title: Port to Dioxus 0.5
candidates.body:
resolves #125

- [x] make it compile
- [x] make it run
- [x] test & fixes
  - [x] 'Refresh' doesn't work?
  - [x] test on Ubuntu

candidates.title: Use external crates in lieu of `./crates`
candidates.body:
- https://github.com/juspay/nix-rs
- https://github.com/juspay/nix-health
- https://github.com/juspay/direnv-rs

candidates.title: fix(nix-health): use `direnv status --json` & create `direnv` crate
candidates.body:
resolves #122 

* fix the broken activation (`direnv allow`) check

candidates.title: `nix_eval_attr_json`: add `default_if_missing` argument
candidates.body: To be used in `nixci`

candidates.title: `nix_rs`: Fix sub-flake URL creation when using local paths
candidates.body: To address https://github.com/srid/nixci/issues/35

candidates.title: Cache retrieved flakes on disk
candidates.body:
Flakes are fetched once and cached on disk, so as to persist across app restarts. To refetch, the user can hit the 'refresh' button.

- [x] dioxus-std storage deserialization issues https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus-std/pull/17#pullrequestreview-1719137114
- [ ] trim cache size?
- [ ] refactor build_network logic

candidates.title: Persist `Signal` state to disk (recently visited flakes now persist)
candidates.body:
For #96 by leveraging https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus-std/pull/17

- [x] "Recent flakes" should work
- [x] Add a default list of flakes (if recent flakes is empty)

candidates.title: Compile tailwind automatically as part of `just watch` (or `nix build/run`)
candidates.body:
Consequently, get rid of the generated CSS file from the git repo.

Uses https://github.com/srid/dioxus-desktop-template/pull/10 - which adjusts nativeBuildInputs to make tailwindcss available to the cargo build.

candidates.title: Build `Signal`s as a network
candidates.body: Not super happy with this change. Signals seem more trouble that worth. Will evaluate the use of simple `use_state` next.

candidates.title: Leptos -> Dioxus Desktop
candidates.body:
- [x] Port leptos code
- [ ] Run `dx fmt` as part of treefmt https://github.com/juspay/nix-browser/issues/81
- [x] nixify packages
- [x] Avoid unnecessary clones
- [x] Nav bar: active/inactive status
- ~~[ ] component should take signals~~ (too early to do this)
- [x] reintroducing loading status everywhere
- [x] final refactor

candidates.title: RAM / disk space health checks
direnv health check
candidates.body:
Resolves  #70

- [x] Fine-grained checks: direnv installed, show its path, etc.
- [x] Notion of 'skipped checks' (direnv check should be skipped for non-local flakes)
- [x] Review/refactor `Checkable` being (partially) gated behind ssr

candidates.title: nix-health: Accept flake URL from CLI arg
Rosetta check
candidates.body: resolves #58

candidates.title: `nix_health`: `trusted_users` check
candidates.body:
Resolves #37 

TODO:
- [x] Change suggestion based on `os` from `SysInfo`

candidates.title: Add CLI for nix-health
candidates.body:
The idea is to eventually supplant https://github.com/srid/nix-health

- [x] Full console reporting
- [x] `nix run` invocation
- [ ] publish crate

candidates.title: Run all tests as part of nix build
Use workspace to decouple library crates
candidates.body:
The `nix` module should live in a crate of its own without coupling with leptos.

- Create `crates/nix_rs` containing nix command types & functions (no UI code)
- Create `crates/nix_health` for health checks (no UI code)
- Create `crates/leptos_extras` containing extra leptos library functions
- Move all leptos UI code out of nix modules, and put them under app module, thus decoupling UI entirely. All UI now lives under `./src/app`.
- Also update cargo deps

<details>
<summary>tasks</summary>

- [x] Initial working version
- Decoupling
  - [x] Decouple `command.rs`? or just `ServerFnError`
  - [x] Decouple `view!` impls?
    - Consider upcoming CLI view as well
    - An idea: create `app/*.rs` for each segment and put the server fns and view impls there.
- [ ] Review tracing logging in library (use parent `nix_rs` span everywhere?)
  - [x] Fix logs missing from project crates
- [x] Make `src/leptos_extra` its own crate
- [x] Use workspace common dependencies
</details>

candidates.title: Nix cache URL check should ignore trailing slash
candidates.body:
substituters = https://cache.nixos.org https://nammayatri.cachix.org

The above config without trailing slash should be considered as correct.

candidates.title: Flake overview
candidates.body:
- `/flake` url shows high-level output kinds
- raw outputs moved to separate page

candidates.title: cli: add verbosity option (`-vv...`)
candidates.body: resolves #36

candidates.title: Add --no-open; automatically open in web browser
Use leptos_query to cache queries in frontend
candidates.body:
#30

uses https://github.com/nicoburniske/leptos_query

- [x] Fix the panic
- [ ] Why is it refetching on route switch?

candidates.title: Parse output of `nix --version`
candidates.body: resolves #28
